channel.title: Services & Tools [Wiki]
channel.description: Hello, 0x00'ers! @zSec gave us the idea to make a Wiki with working services for things such as email relays, SMS spoofing and the like. Feel free to edit this and add things you have tried and tested. The more we add in useful things, with a very quick way to access them, the more useful this page will become. The type of information included here, should not be content for teaching new concepts, but something that you can use for reference once you know the techniques. An almost cheatsheet for Pentesters/Hackers. The little things that make you go: "what was that thing again?" Remember that many hands make light work :slight_smile: # Table of Contents: → 1. [References](#reference) 2. [Shells](#shells) 3. [Recon](#recon) 4. [Rootkits](#rootkit) 5. [Exploitation](#exploit) 6. [BruteForcing](#brute) 7. [Social Engineering](#se) 8. [Doxing](#doxing) 9. [Web Hacking](#webhax) 10. [Exploit Development](#exploitdev) 11. [WiFi Hacking](#wifihax) 12. [Mobile Pentesting](#mobile) 13. [Bluetooth Hacking](#bthacks) 14. [Anonymity](#anon) 15. [Forensics](#foren) 16. [Reverse Engineering](#reversing) 17. [All-In-One OS](#os) 18. [Malware Sample](#malware) --- ## 1. References: → - [Let's Start Study](https://trailofbits.github.io/ctf/) - [CheatSheet](https://cheatsheet.promiselabs.net/) - [My Notpad](https://xapax.gitbooks.io/security/content/) - [ASCII Table](http://ascii.cl/) - Conversion Tools: → - [CyberChef](https://gchq.github.io/CyberChef/) - kinda a Swiss army knife of encoding, decoding, hashing, ect. Quite handy. - [exe2hex](https://github.com/g0tmi1k/exe2hex) - [Direct Download](https://github.com/g0tmi1k/exe2hex/archive/master.zip) ## 2. Shells: → - [Multi Reverse Shell Manager (Platypus)](https://github.com/WangYihang/Platypus/releases) - [PHP Findsock Shell](http://pentestmonkey.net/tools/web-shells/php-findsock-shell) - [Direct Download](http://pentestmonkey.net/tools/php-findsock-shell/php-findsock-shell-1.0.tar.gz) - [PHP Reverse Shell](http://pentestmonkey.net/tools/web-shells/php-reverse-shell) - [Direct Download](http://pentestmonkey.net/tools/php-reverse-shell/php-reverse-shell-1.0.tar.gz) - Get interactive prompt (sudo) - `python -c 'import pty; pty.spawn("/bin/bash")'` - In TTY Shell --> export TERM=linux - [PHPShell](https://git.0x00sec.org/unh0lys0da/PHPshell) - [Direct Download](https://git.0x00sec.org/unh0lys0da/PHPshell/repository/archive.zip) - [WebShell List](https://github.com/tennc/webshell) - [PHP WebShell List](https://github.com/JohnTroony/php-webshells) - [STELF](https://git.0x00sec.org/JSchmoe/unnamed-shell) - [Direct Download](https://git.0x00sec.org/JSchmoe/unnamed-shell/repository/archive.zip) - [Tutorial](https://0x00sec.org/t/how-to-get-a-super-stelfy-shell-that-av-doesnt-pick-up/1860) - [Weevely](https://github.com/epinna/weevely3) - [Direct Download](https://github.com/epinna/weevely3/archive/master.zip) ## 3. [dnSpy](https://github.com/0xd4d/dnSpy): a .NET debugger, decomplier and assembly editor. Mainly uses ILSpy decompiler engine and the Roslyn (C# / Visual Basic) compiler - [radare](https://www.radare.org/r/): The swiss army knife for any RE related task from the commandline - [cutter](https://github.com/radareorg/cutter) A GUI for radare2 ## 17. Operating Systems: → - [Parrot Security](https://www.parrotsec.org/) - [Download Page](https://www.parrotsec.org/download.php) - [Kali Linux](https://www.kali.org/) - [Download Page](https://www.kali.org/downloads/) - [Kali Nethunter](https://www.kali.org/kali-linux-nethunter/) - [Download Page](https://www.kali.org/kali-linux-nethunter/) - [Blackarch Linux](https://blackarch.org/) - [Download Page](https://blackarch.org/downloads.html) - [Backbox Linux](https://www.backbox.org/) - [Download Page](https://www.backbox.org/download/) - [Samuari Web Testing Framework](http://www.samurai-wtf.org/) - [Download Page](https://sourceforge.net/projects/samurai/files/) - [WeakNet's Demon Linux](https://www.demonlinux.com/about.php) - [Download Page](https://www.demonlinux.com/download.php) - [Pentoo](http://www.pentoo.ch/) - [Download Page](http://www.pentoo.ch/download/) - [Windows 7 Ultimate SP1 64bit Official with Proof](https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/18zLcP31cYN2oRANXadCAwddZ_K_aT_Lt?usp=sharing) - [Windows 7 Ultimate SP1 64bit Official Virtual Machine(vmware) Updated till Feb, 2019](https://drive.google.com/open?id=19zQaDzdi9yqSptg4o0i5UyT8F2Bn8mOM) - [Complete Mandiant Offensive VM (Commando VM)](https://github.com/fireeye/commando-vm) ## 18. Malware Samples: → - [Direct Download 44GB](https://drive.google.com/open?id=1AxHbYpRL_uEpWJfBs8_bNKgeWJkfR-PB) -[Interactive Malware Sandbox](https://any.run) ## 19. OSINT Framework: → - [OSINT framework](https://osintframework.com)

item.title: Services & Tools [Wiki]
item.dc:creator: m242
item.description:
AFAIK it’s a personal taste question that really pushes you towards one or the other “hacking distro”.
As an Arch user, I prefer Blackarch because I can install it’s repo on top of a fresh install, but I also use Kali when I don’t want logs.

ParrotSec is really user-friendly, Kali is designed as a live usb distro, and Blackarch has a lot of tools and WM.
I never used the other two.

Read full topic

  • Blackarch - Download Page

I personally find that Parrot-sec and Samurai Web look interesting since i haven’t used them yet i cant really say anything about them though
